data.title: Once upon a time… Vasa Dynasty and Rembrandt.

data.text: Vasa Dynasty and Rembrandt. The commissions from the 17th Century. Portraits painted in the pose 'akimbo' or holding gloves in the hand, is a way to depict a honouring pose, for a person(s) who recently passed away. Our understanding of the 'reason' for such portraits commissions are now completely forgotten, aswel the natural language of the hand 'Chirologia'. Władysław Konstanty, Count of Wasenau added, both paintings for Władysław Konstanty and Sigismund Casimir Vasa added from 1645 by Rembrandt (IRR and signature) Added the origin of the Salome (Mariana of Austria) asking for the head of John the Baptist (Gerhard Dönhoff) by Rembrandt of 164 Etch of Cecilia Renata and Court Chamberlain Adam Kazanowski Painting of Ibrahim He was born in Constantinople, the son of sultan Ahmed I by Kösem Sultan, an ethnic Greek originally named Anastasia. Angel crown prince Sigismund Casimir Vasa with Hedwig Łuszkowska as mother in Law Pendant of Wladyslaw 1637 in the royal collection of England All the supposed Rembrandt selfportraits are not selfportrait of himself, but are portraits of a Polish Prince called Charles Ferdinand Vasa. (except 3) It can hardly be without significance that after 1642 a remarkable silence descends over this area. As with the other categories of Rembrandt's painted works, so with the self-portraits there follows a break in production that is still not satisfactorily explained. Page 249. Corpus Rembrandt part IV. The reason is that these are all ‘not' self portraits and events coincide with the sitter Prince Charles Ferdinand Vasa 1633 † Sigismund III Vasa 1635 † Cardinal John Albert Vasa. The reason that we see the cathedral in the background 1640 Governer of Plock 1640 Baptise of the Crown prince…the reason for the cathedral in the background 1640 † George William (prusia in december) 1644 † Cecilia Renata Vasa 1647 † Sigismund Casimir Vasa Crown Prince † 1648 † Władysław IV † 1648/9 King in function until new elections (Rulers staff) Source T.3_1647-1656_1980 [Radziwiłł Albrycht Stanisław] page 137 1650 † Jan Mikolaj Danilowice † Crown Chancellor 1652 † John Sigismund Vasa 1653 † Príncipe-arzobispo Paris von Lodron
